location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 63: William Digges Latouche, Resident at Bussora [Basra], to Edward Galley, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter to Edward Galley, Resident at Bushire, reports the arrival at Bussora [Basra] of a person describing himself as a Bohemian, who is suspected of being a Frenchman with important letters for India. The man in question is seeking to accompany Mr Outrey to Muscat. The letter discusses intercepting the Frenchman using the Mercuryand taking him to Bombay. In addition, the letter also discusses reports, sent by Consul Abbot of Aleppo, regarding Mr Bardarque, a French merchant.
